result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Herbert Stuart Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All costs, fees, and other surcharges have been paid in full from the bond funds posted in this matter.
The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick Herbert Stuart Jr.

records.addlTxt: 11:46 AM Defendant Patrick Herbert Stuart Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Alysja Otten appeared by video for Patrick Herbert Stuart Jr. District Attorney James Rennicke appears by video for the State. Case on for Status Conference.  Attorney Rennicke updates the Court: lab has not tested, but offer has been extended for a single charge of paraphernalia with a joint rec for court costs.  Def confirms understanding and acceptance of offer.  Discussion of defendant's bond.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2: Possession of drug paraphernalia and orders a JOC; Count 1 is DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  Court orders $500 fine and costs- to be taken from cash bond posted.  Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff within 2 weeks.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

3:20 PM Defendant Patrick Herbert Stuart Jr. in court.  Attorneys Alysja Otten in person and Atty Ryan Reid by video  for Patrick Herbert Stuart Jr.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney Otten updates the Court: ready to proceed to trial- no resolution.  Court confirms her understanding of the offer.  State extends new offer- if def pleads to misdemeanor bail jump and misdemeanor possession of paraphernalia, would recommend 1 yr probation.  Off the record 3:22 PM.  Back on the record 3:35 PM, same appearances as previously noted.  Atty Otten updates- still requesting jury trial.  Trial must be done with DA Rennicke as ADA Schmidt has a conflict.  DA Rennicke is unavailable on the trial date as scheduled; this will need to be rescheduled.

11:16 AM Defendant, Patrick Herbert Stuart, appeared by phone with Attorney Alysja Otten by video.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.   Case was scheduled for PH but Atty advised Court prior to hearing that it will be a waiver.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information.  Motions reserved by Ms. Otten.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Court takes judicial notices of Washburn County Case #21CF136.  DA advises court of offer.
  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Discovery Demand

records.addlTxt: No contact with the victim or their residence.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
